nnfrMib.name: nnfrMib

revisions.description: Initial version of this MIB module.

nnfrMib.contactinfo: Nortel Networks 8200 Dixie Road Brampton, Ontario L6T 5P6 Canada 1-800-4Nortel www.nortelnetworks.com
nnfrMib.description: This file contains MIB module for Frame Relay implementation.

nnfrTable.name: nnfrTable
nnfrTable.description: A list of a Frame Relay interface configuration parameters. The table contains parameters for both the uni and multi link frame-relay interface.

nnfrTableEntry.name: nnfrTableEntry
nnfrTableEntry.description: An entry in the frTable. The bundle Id forms the index into the table.

nnfrIfEnable.name: nnfrIfEnable
nnfrIfEnable.description: Enables or disables the frame-relay interface. By default frame- relay interface is enabled. Writing zero (0) disables frame-relay interface.

nnfrEnablePvcAll.name: nnfrEnablePvcAll
nnfrEnablePvcAll.description: Enables all PVCs related to the interface. By default all PVCs related to an interface are disabled. Writing One (1) enables all PVCs at the same time for an interface indexed by bundleId.

nnfrFrameSize.name: nnfrFrameSize
nnfrFrameSize.description: Maximum Size of the frame that will be configured for this Frame Relay interface. The value for frame size ranges from 56 to 4096 bytes, with a default value of 1600 bytes.

nnfrIfType.name: nnfrIfType
nnfrIfType.description: Indicates the interface type for the frame-relay interface.

nnfrLmiType.name: nnfrLmiType
nnfrLmiType.description: Local management Interface type for the frame-relay interface. It can take any of the following three values: ansi - ANSI T1.617 (Annex D), cisco - Cisco LMI, q933a - ITU-T Q.933 (Annex A) To disable lmi operation, set the value to none(0).

nnfrLmiDceN392.name: nnfrLmiDceN392
nnfrLmiDceN392.description: DCE/UNI error threshold value. Ranges from 1 to 10, with a default value of 9. To configure the value of this variable, LMI type should be configured.

nnfrLmiDceN393.name: nnfrLmiDceN393
nnfrLmiDceN393.description: DCE/UNI monitored events count. Ranges from 1 to 10, with a default value of 10. To configure the value of this variable, LMI type should be configured.

nnfrLmiDteN392.name: nnfrLmiDteN392
nnfrLmiDteN392.description: DTE/UNI error threshold. Ranges from 1 to 10, with a default value of 9. To configure the value of this variable, LMI type should be configured.

nnfrLmiDteN393.name: nnfrLmiDteN393
nnfrLmiDteN393.description: DTE/UNI monitored events count. Ranges from 1 to 10, with a default value of 10. To configure the value of this variable, LMI type should be configured.

nnfrLmiDteN391.name: nnfrLmiDteN391
nnfrLmiDteN391.description: DTE/UNI full status polling interval. Ranges from 1 to 255, with a default value of 6. To configure the value of this variable, LMI type should be configured.

nnfrLmiKeepalive.name: nnfrLmiKeepalive
nnfrLmiKeepalive.description: Local management interface keepalive polling interval time in seconds. The value for this ranges from 5 seconds to 255 seconds with a default value of 10 seconds. To configure the value of this variable, LMI type should be configured.

nnmfrAckMsgTimer.name: nnmfrAckMsgTimer
nnmfrAckMsgTimer.description: The time to wait for an ADD_LINK_ACK message before timing out.

nnmfrAckMsgMaxRetry.name: nnmfrAckMsgMaxRetry
nnmfrAckMsgMaxRetry.description: Maximum number of Retries for the Ack Msg. This variable can be set on a multilink bundle.

nnmfrClass.name: nnmfrClass
nnmfrClass.description: classA -- bundle is UP when 1 link is UP classB -- bundle is UP when all links are UP classC -- bundle is UP when user-specific # of links are UP. In the case of classC, mfrClassThreshold should be configured with mfrClass in an atomic set operation. This variable can be set on a multilink bundle but not on a uni link bundle.

nnmfrClassThreshold.name: nnmfrClassThreshold
nnmfrClassThreshold.description: Threshold - minimum number of links required to activate bundle, for a mfrClass, classC. This variable can be set on a multilink bundle but not on a uni link bundle.

nnmfrFrameSize.name: nnmfrFrameSize
nnmfrFrameSize.description: The frame size for multi-link frame relay. This variable can be set on a multilink bundle but not on a uni link bundle.

nnmfrHelloTimer.name: nnmfrHelloTimer
nnmfrHelloTimer.description: Hello timer in seconds. This variable can be set on a multilink bundle but not on a uni link bundle.

nnmfrSegThreshold.name: nnmfrSegThreshold
nnmfrSegThreshold.description: Segment threshold packet size in bytes. This variable can be set on a multilink bundle but not on a uni link bundle.

nnmfrDiffDelay.name: nnmfrDiffDelay
nnmfrDiffDelay.description: Differential delay in milli seconds. This variable can be set on a multilink bundle but not on a uni link bundle.

nnfrPvcTable.name: nnfrPvcTable
nnfrPvcTable.description: A list of Frame Relay PVC parameters.

nnfrPvcDlci.name: nnfrPvcDlci
nnfrPvcDlci.description: Data Link Connection Identifier of the PVC. The value ranges from 16 to 991. The Dlci is unique for a bundle but Dlci numbers can be reused across bundles.

nnfrPvcEnable.name: nnfrPvcEnable
nnfrPvcEnable.description: Enables PVC for given interface name and DLCI number. By default PVC is enabled. Writing one(1) on this enables PVC, zero (0) disables it.

nnfrPvcIpAddr.name: nnfrPvcIpAddr
nnfrPvcIpAddr.description: IP address to be configured for the PVC. PVC IP subnet Mask variable should also be configured alongwith this variable. A set on this variable will be successful only if the subnetmask is also set in the same request. To unconfigure the Ip address, a set is issued with the value of the ip address as 0.0.0.0

nnfrPvcIpSubnetMask.name: nnfrPvcIpSubnetMask
nnfrPvcIpSubnetMask.description: Subnet mask to be configured alongwith PVC IP address. This variable should be configured alongwith PVC IP address.

nnfrPvcRemoteIpAddr.name: nnfrPvcRemoteIpAddr
nnfrPvcRemoteIpAddr.description: Remote IP address to be mapped for PVC

nnfrPvcPolicingEnable.name: nnfrPvcPolicingEnable
nnfrPvcPolicingEnable.description: This variable is to disable/enable policing for PVC. Writing zero (0) on this disables policing for the PVC. By default policing is enabled.

nnfrPvcPolicingDe.name: nnfrPvcPolicingDe
nnfrPvcPolicingDe.description: If enabled, received frames that exceed policing threshold, will be tagged with DE bit. This variable can be configured only if policing is enabled.

nnfrPvcPolicingCir.name: nnfrPvcPolicingCir
nnfrPvcPolicingCir.description: Committed Information Rate( bits per second ) in receive direction for PVC. This variable can be configured only if policing is enabled.

nnfrPvcPolicingBc.name: nnfrPvcPolicingBc
nnfrPvcPolicingBc.description: Committed Burst ( bits ) in receive direction for PVC. This variable can be configured only if policing is enabled.

nnfrPvcPolicingBe.name: nnfrPvcPolicingBe
nnfrPvcPolicingBe.description: Excess burst ( bits ) in receive direction for PVC. This variable can be configured only if policing enabled.

nnfrPvcShapingCir.name: nnfrPvcShapingCir
nnfrPvcShapingCir.description: The committed information rate (in bits per second) to be configured for the PVC.

nnfrPvcShapingBcMax.name: nnfrPvcShapingBcMax
nnfrPvcShapingBcMax.description: The maximum committed burst (bits) to be configured for the PVC.

nnfrPvcShapingBcMin.name: nnfrPvcShapingBcMin
nnfrPvcShapingBcMin.description: The minimum committed burst (bits) to be configured for the PVC.

nnfrPvcShapingBe.name: nnfrPvcShapingBe
nnfrPvcShapingBe.description: The excess burst (bits) to be configured for the PVC.

nnfrPvcDlciForSwitching.name: nnfrPvcDlciForSwitching
nnfrPvcDlciForSwitching.description: Data Link Connection Identifier of the PVC. The value for this variable ranges from 16 to 991. frPvcBundleNameForSwitching should be set with frPvcDlciForSwitching as an atomic set.

nnfrPvcBundleNameForSwitching.name: nnfrPvcBundleNameForSwitching
nnfrPvcBundleNameForSwitching.description: The name of the bundle configured for Switching.

nnfrPvcRowStatus.name: nnfrPvcRowStatus
nnfrPvcRowStatus.description: To create a row set row status to a value CreateAndGo(4), indexed by bundle Id and the desired dlci number.

nnfrStatsTable.name: nnfrStatsTable
nnfrStatsTable.description: The statistics objects for a frame-relay interface.

nnfrStatsFECNsRx.name: nnfrStatsFECNsRx
nnfrStatsFECNsRx.description: Number of frames received with FECN bit on

nnfrStatsBECNsRx.name: nnfrStatsBECNsRx
nnfrStatsBECNsRx.description: Number of frames received with BECN bit on.

nnfrStatsInvDLCIsRx.name: nnfrStatsInvDLCIsRx
nnfrStatsInvDLCIsRx.description: Number of frames with invalid dlci received

nnfrStatsUnknownDLCIsRx.name: nnfrStatsUnknownDLCIsRx
nnfrStatsUnknownDLCIsRx.description: Number of frames with unknown dlci received

nnfrPvcStatsTableEntry.name: nnfrPvcStatsTableEntry
nnfrPvcStatsTableEntry.description: An entry in the FrPvcStats Table

nnfrPvcStatsBytesRxLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrPvcStatsBytesRxLastBootOrClear
nnfrPvcStatsBytesRxLastBootOrClear.description: Number of bytes received on a pvc since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrPvcStatsBytesTxLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrPvcStatsBytesTxLastBootOrClear
nnfrPvcStatsBytesTxLastBootOrClear.description: Number of bytes transmitted on a pvc since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrPvcStatsPktsRxLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrPvcStatsPktsRxLastBootOrClear
nnfrPvcStatsPktsRxLastBootOrClear.description: Number of packets received since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrPvcStatsPktsTxLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrPvcStatsPktsTxLastBootOrClear
nnfrPvcStatsPktsTxLastBootOrClear.description: Number of packets transmitted since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrPvcStatsErrPktsRxLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrPvcStatsErrPktsRxLastBootOrClear
nnfrPvcStatsErrPktsRxLastBootOrClear.description: Number of errored packets received since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrPvcStatsUpDownStatesLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrPvcStatsUpDownStatesLastBootOrClear
nnfrPvcStatsUpDownStatesLastBootOrClear.description: Number of times state(up or down) of the pvc changed in since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrPvcStatsBytesRxLastFiveMins.name: nnfrPvcStatsBytesRxLastFiveMins
nnfrPvcStatsBytesRxLastFiveMins.description: Number of bytes received in the last five minutes.

nnfrPvcStatsBytesTxLastFiveMins.name: nnfrPvcStatsBytesTxLastFiveMins
nnfrPvcStatsBytesTxLastFiveMins.description: Number of bytes transmitted in the last five minutes.

nnfrPvcStatsPktsRxLastFiveMins.name: nnfrPvcStatsPktsRxLastFiveMins
nnfrPvcStatsPktsRxLastFiveMins.description: Number of packets received in the last five minutes.

nnfrPvcStatsPktsTxLastFiveMins.name: nnfrPvcStatsPktsTxLastFiveMins
nnfrPvcStatsPktsTxLastFiveMins.description: Number of packets transmitted in the last five minutes.

nnfrPvcStatsErrPktsRxLastFiveMins.name: nnfrPvcStatsErrPktsRxLastFiveMins
nnfrPvcStatsErrPktsRxLastFiveMins.description: Number of errored packets received in the last five minutes.

nnfrPvcStatsUpDownStatesLastFiveMins.name: nnfrPvcStatsUpDownStatesLastFiveMins
nnfrPvcStatsUpDownStatesLastFiveMins.description: Number of times state(up or down) of the pvc changed in the last five minutes.

nnfrAvcTable.name: nnfrAvcTable
nnfrAvcTable.description: End-to-End MFR avc parameters are defined in this table.

nnfrAvcTableEntry.name: nnfrAvcTableEntry
nnfrAvcTableEntry.description: avc parameter entries are listed in this table.

nnfrAvcId.name: nnfrAvcId
nnfrAvcId.description: frAvcId is the identifier of an avc. To configure an avc, this parameter must be used as the index. This is assigned internally by the system. Whenever a row creation needs to occur in the avcTable, the frAvcId is entered as 65535.

nnfrAvcDlci.name: nnfrAvcDlci
nnfrAvcDlci.description: Data Link Connection Identifier of the avc. The value ranges from 16 to 1022. This number is unique across all the avcs created. Once set during creation, it can't be changed.

nnfrAvcName.name: nnfrAvcName
nnfrAvcName.description: Name of the avc. To configure an avc, this parameter must be set. That is, a descriptive name should be given to an avc. The maximum length of an avc name is 8 characters. This parameter is set once during the creation of an avc. an avc can not be renamed.

nnfrAvcIpAddr.name: nnfrAvcIpAddr
nnfrAvcIpAddr.description: The avc's source IP address. This is one of the parameters required to set up IP multiplexing for an avc. Also the parameters avcIpAddr and avcSubnetMask have to be set together during the same request. To unconfigure the IP address, a set operation is performed with the value 0.0.0.0

nnfrAvcIpSubnetMask.name: nnfrAvcIpSubnetMask
nnfrAvcIpSubnetMask.description: This parameter represents the source subnet mask address. This is one of the parameters required to set up IP multiplexing for a avc. This parameter is set along with the avcIpAddr parameter during the same request.

nnfrAvcRemoteIpAddr.name: nnfrAvcRemoteIpAddr
nnfrAvcRemoteIpAddr.description: Remote IP address to be mapped for the avc. If configured, the arp table is updated with this static entry and inverse arp request packets are no longer sent for this interface.To unconfigure this parameter, a set operation is performed with the value 0.0.0.0 .

nnfrAvcClass.name: nnfrAvcClass
nnfrAvcClass.description: classA -- avc is UP when at least 1 cvc is UP classB -- avc is UP when all cvcs are UP classC -- avc is UP when user-specified # of cvcs are UP classD -- avc is UP when user-specified min. CIR of each cvc is met classE -- avc is UP when user-specified min. CIR of the avc is met In the case of classC/D/E, frAvcClassThreshold should be configured along with avcClass in an atomic set operation.

nnfrAvcClassThreshold.name: nnfrAvcClassThreshold
nnfrAvcClassThreshold.description: Threshold - minimum number of links required to activate bundle, for the avcClass 'classC'. For 'classD' or 'classE', the value will be in bits per second. For 'classA' and 'classB', this value will hold no significance.

nnfrAvcFragmentSize.name: nnfrAvcFragmentSize
nnfrAvcFragmentSize.description: The frame size for multi-link frame relay End-to-End avc in bytes. This value defines the maximum size of any fragment that can be transmitted on any cvc. Frames larger than this size must be fragmented.

nnfrAvcSegThreshold.name: nnfrAvcSegThreshold
nnfrAvcSegThreshold.description: Segment threshold packet size in bytes. This value defines the minimum size of any fragment that can be transmitted on any cvc. Frames smaller than this size must not be fragmented.

nnfrAvcSequence.name: nnfrAvcSequence
nnfrAvcSequence.description: multilink frame relay sequence number length (short = 12 bits ; long = 24 bits.24 bit sequence space increases MFR header by 2 more bytes, but in those situations where the differential delay is high ( > 50 ms ), larger sequence numbers help reduce packet drops that can happen when short sequence numbers complete a cycle quickly.

nnfrAvcDiffDelay.name: nnfrAvcDiffDelay
nnfrAvcDiffDelay.description: Differential delay in milli seconds. This variable can be set only when the AVC is in Enhanced FRF.15 mode. This value indicates the maximum tolerable differential delay between any two CVCs. Any CVC whose diff. delay value exceeds this configured value will be brought down from active data transfer until it's diff. delay values recover. Possible Values: 0 and 10ms to 128ms.Setting the value of 0 will disable diff. delay related CVC bring down feature.

nnfrAvcEnhancedMode.name: nnfrAvcEnhancedMode
nnfrAvcEnhancedMode.description: Enhanced FRF.15 mode is a modification of the standard FRF.15 to improve the end to end CVC status integrity and to calculate and act on differential delay build up. By default, the AVC is created in Standard FRF.15 mode.

nnfrAvcNoOfCvcs.name: nnfrAvcNoOfCvcs
nnfrAvcNoOfCvcs.description: Indicates the number of links configured in the avc.

nnfrAvcTotalBw.name: nnfrAvcTotalBw
nnfrAvcTotalBw.description: Indicates the total bandwidth for this avc. The avc bandwidth is the aggregated band- widths of all the links assigned to a particular avc.

nnfrAvcEnable.name: nnfrAvcEnable
nnfrAvcEnable.description: Enables the AVC. By default AVC is enabled. Writing one(1) on this enables AVC, zero(0) disables it.

nnfrAvcRowStatus.name: nnfrAvcRowStatus
nnfrAvcRowStatus.description: frAvcRowStatus is used to add/delete a row in the table. Adding or deleting a row corresponds to creating an avc or deleting an avc. In order to add a row to the avc table, a set on this parameter should be done with the value 4 (createAndGo) and frAvcId index to be used is 65535. A request to create a row can be completed successfully only if a set on the avcRowStatus(4), frAvcName and frAvcDlci come in the same request. To delete a row this parameter has to be set with the value 6 (destroy).

nnfrCvcTable.name: nnfrCvcTable
nnfrCvcTable.description: End-to-End MFR cvc parameters are defined in this table.

nnfrCvcTableEntry.name: nnfrCvcTableEntry
nnfrCvcTableEntry.description: cvc parameter entries are listed in this table.

nnfrCvcBundleName.name: nnfrCvcBundleName
nnfrCvcBundleName.description: The name of the bundle of the CVC which needs to be added to the avc. This parameter is used for display only.

nnfrCvcEnable.name: nnfrCvcEnable
nnfrCvcEnable.description: Enables/disables the CVC. By default CVC is enabled. Writing one(1) on this enables CVC, zero(0) disables it.

nnfrCvcRowStatus.name: nnfrCvcRowStatus
nnfrCvcRowStatus.description: frCvcRowStatus is used to add/delete a row in the table. Adding or deleting a row corresponds to adding or removing a CVC from an AVC. Adding a new row will require to index by the frAvcId,bundleId and frPvcDlci. Use proper index values and set RowStatus to CreateAndGo (4) to create a new row. To destroy, use value Destroy (6).

nnfrAvcStatsTable.name: nnfrAvcStatsTable
nnfrAvcStatsTable.description: The statistics objects for a frame-relay interface.

nnfrAvcStatsBytesRxLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrAvcStatsBytesRxLastBootOrClear
nnfrAvcStatsBytesRxLastBootOrClear.description: Number of bytes received on an avc since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrAvcStatsBytesTxLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrAvcStatsBytesTxLastBootOrClear
nnfrAvcStatsBytesTxLastBootOrClear.description: Number of bytes transmitted on an avc since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrAvcStatsPktsRxLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrAvcStatsPktsRxLastBootOrClear
nnfrAvcStatsPktsRxLastBootOrClear.description: Number of packets received since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrAvcStatsPktsTxLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrAvcStatsPktsTxLastBootOrClear
nnfrAvcStatsPktsTxLastBootOrClear.description: Number of packets transmitted since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrAvcStatsErrPktsRxLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrAvcStatsErrPktsRxLastBootOrClear
nnfrAvcStatsErrPktsRxLastBootOrClear.description: Number of errored packets received since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrAvcStatsUpDownStatesLastBootOrClear.name: nnfrAvcStatsUpDownStatesLastBootOrClear
nnfrAvcStatsUpDownStatesLastBootOrClear.description: Number of times state(up or down) of the avc changed in since boot or last statistics clear.

nnfrAvcStatsBytesRxLastFiveMins.name: nnfrAvcStatsBytesRxLastFiveMins
nnfrAvcStatsBytesRxLastFiveMins.description: Number of bytes received in the last five minutes.

nnfrAvcStatsBytesTxLastFiveMins.name: nnfrAvcStatsBytesTxLastFiveMins
nnfrAvcStatsBytesTxLastFiveMins.description: Number of bytes transmitted in the last five minutes.

nnfrAvcStatsPktsRxLastFiveMins.name: nnfrAvcStatsPktsRxLastFiveMins
nnfrAvcStatsPktsRxLastFiveMins.description: Number of packets received in the last five minutes.

nnfrAvcStatsPktsTxLastFiveMins.name: nnfrAvcStatsPktsTxLastFiveMins
nnfrAvcStatsPktsTxLastFiveMins.description: Number of packets transmitted in the last five minutes.

nnfrAvcStatsErrPktsRxLastFiveMins.name: nnfrAvcStatsErrPktsRxLastFiveMins
nnfrAvcStatsErrPktsRxLastFiveMins.description: Number of errored packets received in the last five minutes.

nnfrAvcStatsUpDownStatesLastFiveMins.name: nnfrAvcStatsUpDownStatesLastFiveMins
nnfrAvcStatsUpDownStatesLastFiveMins.description: Number of times state(up or down) of the avc changed in the last five minutes.
